resource.name: T1 AVR
resource.description: AVR is a measure of persons per vehicle calculated by dividing the number of employees arriving or departing the worksite by the number of vehicles used to commute to and from the worksite. AVR is calculated using information about employee commute patterns collected over a five day survey period. The minimum AVR attainment goal is 1.5 persons per vehicle for the morning commute period (6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m.) and the evening commute period (3:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.)

resource.name: SLE5 Income Diversity
resource.description: Ratio of Santa Monica households earning less than $25,000/year to households earning more than $100,000/year. Household income is provided by US Census. Intervening years are estimated by city staff.

resource.name: HD 2 Public Safety
resource.description: Crime related data based on the UCR uniform crime reporting statistics submitted by the Police Department

resource.name: T12 Emergency Resp Times Police
resource.description: Police response times by Priority: 0 being emergency and 5 being a report call.

resource.name: AC2 Creative Sector Activity
columns_name: plp employed in the creative sector

resource.name: RC 3 Municipal Energy Use-2
resource.description: Electricity and natural gas usage in buildings and facilities; vehicle fuel use from vehicle fleet and transit fleet. The City procures RECs to offset almost 100% of its SCE accounts. Emissions related to electricity use reflect the actual grid without the use of RECs. The Climate Registry has only recently recognized the use of RECs.

resource.name: T10 Bus Travel Time
resource.description: On time performance provided by Transit Master. Annual target of 75%.

resource.name: T7 Vehicle Use
resource.description: Total registered vehicles in Santa Monica by zip code and total clean air vehicles that have registered for the Zero-Emission Vehicle designation or the Super Low Emission Vehicle designation.
columns_name: Clean Air Vehicles percentage of Total
columns_description: Super or Ultra Low Emission Vehicles

resource.name: T10 Ped Volumes
resource.description:
The City conducts transportation counts, which counts the numbers of vehicles,
pedestrians, and bicycles moving through an intersection. Counts are typically
conducted every 2 years during the weekday and weekend peak hours. The peak
hours represents the time period where traffic counts are the highest due to worker
commute. Weekday counts are conducted at all City signalized intersections during the
AM Peak Hours (7:00 A -9:00 AM) and PM peak hours (5:30 PM – 7:30 PM) either on a
Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday in the Fall (when school is in session). Weekend
counts are conducted during the midday peak hour (1:00-5:00 PM) either on Saturday
or Sunday in the Summer at signalized intersections in the Downtown and Main Street
areas, as these areas tend to experience greater traffic as a result of the tourist/visitor
population on the weekends. The table below provides the number of intersections that
were counted in 2007 – 2013.

resource.name: H2 Availability of Affordable Housing
resource.description: Total new and existing affordable housing reported since the implementation of Proposition R. Proposition R has two requirements regarding affordable housing. First, it requires that 30 percent of all multifamily housing completed in each fiscal year be affordable to low-and moderate-income households. Second, Proposition R requires that at least one-half of the total affordable housing completed be affordable for low-income households.
columns_name: Number low and very- low income residences

resource.name: EPH10 Community Gardens
resource.description: Includes number of connected gardens, average wait for a plot, and total number of particpants

resource.name: LEED Housing Since 2010-3
columns_name: Total Multi-family Residential Units Added since 2010

resource.name: OSLU4 Regionally Appropriate Vegetation
resource.description: Regionally appropriate vegetation installed and maintained by the Public Landscape Division.
columns_name: Total Turf Installed in Public Projects

resource.name: T12 Emergency Resp Times Fire
resource.description: Fire service standards are established by the National Fire Protection Agency (NFPA); NFPA Standard 1710 addresses the performance measure of travel time and sets its standards by percentiles rather than averages. According to NFPA 1710: The fire department’s fire suppression resources shall be deployed to provide for the arrival of an engine company within a 240-second travel time to 90 percent of the incidents; in 2014 SMFD responded to 70% of the incidents within a 240-second travel time. When considering travel time, it is important to understand that travel time is affected by population density, traffic, construction zones, street closures, etc.

resource.name: EPH5 City Purchase Of Sustainable Products
SLE3 Cost Of Living Rent Burden
resource.description: The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) maintains that tenants are rent burdened if more than 30 percent of household income is used for rent. Data is collected via the US Census ACS 5-year estimates.

resource.name: OSLU2 Trees
resource.description: Annual tree plantings and removals. Total tree count is estimated.

resource.name: Housing Bus Stops
resource.description: Location of bus btops to determine livability of new housing.

columns_name: Commission on the Status of Women

columns_name: Support for Arts in Non-Profit orgs in SM

resource.name: OSLU3 Parks Accessibility
resource.description: Households and population estimated to be within 1/4 and 1/2 mile from parks and beach.

resource.name: H5_LivableHousing
resource.description: Percent of residents living in proximity to goods and services

resource.name: RC 5 GHG Emissions
resource.description: Carbon emissions are generated from the use of fossil fuels, primarily coal, natural gas, gasoline and diesel. Fossil fuels consumed at the community level as well as the City operations level are tracked and converted into carbon dioxide equivalents (metric tons or MTCO2e). The City develops plans, policies and programs to help reduce the carbon footprint of the community and its operations.
columns_name: Gov Op Buildings / Facilities - Natural Gas

resource.name: SLE2 Jobs Housing Balance
resource.description: Ratio of the number of jobs in Santa Monica to the amount of housing.

resource.name: T7_VehicleUse_2
columns_name: Clean Air Vehicles percentage of Total
